newsitem.title: PERU: PERU'S JULY TAX REVENUES UP 1.8 PCT VS YEAR AGO.
newsitem.headline: PERU'S JULY TAX REVENUES UP 1.8 PCT VS YEAR AGO.

text.p: Peru's tax revenues in July were 1.874 billion soles, 1.8 percent higher in real terms than in the same month last year, the National Superintendency of Tax Administration (SUNAT) said Tuesday.
Tax revenues for the first seven months of the year were 13.426 billion soles, up 4.9 percent in real terms from the same period last year, SUNAT said in its monthly report.
Tax revenues rose 4.9 percent in real terms during 1996 to 19.94 billion soles.
